experience: You and Jillian both know Matt Greene, Monte Cahn, and 114 others
Sunset surf  .  Photograph . By Marco Petrarci .
KINDNESS is the language that the deaf can hear and the blind can see ⚜️
And I found out in the worst way.
When my manager greeted me with a smile, I couldn't even look at him.
I wasn't ready for the conversation.
Instead, I broke down and told all my coworkers at lunch time.
"They're letting me go. I saw my job posted online."
"That's how the last two people in your position found out."
In a brief second, every employee lost faith in management.
The next few days, I did zero work.
I  applied to hundreds of jobs.
At the end of the week, I got an email from my CEO.
I walked into her office ready to quit.
She said, "We understand you saw your job posted online. To be upfront, we are looking for someone else."
I replied, "I won't wait here. It's best I go."
I left never wanting to hear the company's name again.
It doesn't matter how talented your employees are.
It doesn't matter how much funding you secure.
No matter how small the details.
Because companies are not built on the foundation of revenue.
They're built on the foundation of mutual respect.

Army Sergeant Douglas J. Riney, 26, from Fairview, Illinois was killed on October 19, 2016 by hostile enemy forces on a military base in Kabul, Afghanistan. Sgt. Riney was assigned to the Support Squadron, 3rd Cavalry Regiment, 1st Cavalry Division, Fort Hood, Texas, supporting Opeation Freedon's Sentinel.
Please help us honor him so he will never be forgotten.
